name: Dante Ferretti
biography:
Born in Macerata, Italy in 1943.
He began his film career in 1960 and he worked as art director with Pier Paolo Pasolini on such films as "Medea" and "The Decameron" and later with Federico Fellini on "The City of Women" and "Ginger and Fred."  Recent credits include Martin Scorsese's films "Age of Innocence", "Casino", and "Kundun".
Member: IATSE Local 876, United Scenic Aritst, Local 829, and Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.
